chat_history: WAITRESS: Warm-up?
Narrator: On Cris Young again.
CRIS: Just the check.
Narrator: She sets it on the table with a flirtatious smile. He takes it to the register and pays cash.
CRIS: "The future ain't what it used to be." Ever hear that expression?
Narrator: A moment later, A SECOND CRIS follows the first Cris to theregister, repeating his every movement.
CRIS: It's a joke, but it's true. The future changes every time you look at it. Because you looked at it.
Narrator: As Cris 2 pays cash, Cris 1 proceeds into the casino.
CRIS: Cause once you see it, you're different.
Narrator: Cris 2 follows, literally walking in Cris 1's footsteps.
CRIS: Maybe just a little.
Narrator: A DRUNK bumps into Cris 1 and spills his Daiquiri on him.
CRIS: And that changes everything else.
Narrator: Cris 2 -- the real Cris -- follows a moment later and sidesteps the Drunk, who spills his Daiquiri on someone else.
CRIS: It's got something to do with quantum physics.
Narrator: Cris 2 reaches the gaming tables and merges with Cris 1.
CRIS: That's why I stay away from roulette and craps. It only takes a millionth of an ounce to change a roll. Just placing a different bet can throw things off.
Narrator: A roulette ball skitters indecisively between two grooves before settling into one of them.
CRIS: I've got other rules, too. I don't play against people, like at poker. Only against the house.
Narrator: Slot machines. Horse racing. Sports games.
CRIS: And my goal isn't to win big. At least not any more. The idea is to go unnoticed so I can keep coming back to the trough.
Narrator: He passes the MILLION DOLLAR SLOT. Stops, like it's callingout to him.
CRIS: So no jackpots. No long shots. No big bets except when I want `em to see me lose.
Narrator: Cris notices a DESPERATE GAMBLER on the verge of tears. Clearly, he's dropped a bundle. Cris approaches him andpoints to the MILLION DOLLAR SLOT.
CRIS: Try that one, man. I've got a feeling. Gambler (suspicious) Then you play it.
CRIS: Against my religion.
Narrator: Cris offers the guy a handful of silver dollars.
CRIS: Do it, quick, before somebody else gets there.

Narrator: While the Gambler dawdles, a MIDWESTERN DOWAGER plants herself at the MEGA-SLOT and starts feeding it dollars. Cris sighs and walks off. The Gambler watches him go, then reacts to BELLS, FLASHINGLIGHTS, and SHRIEKS OF CELEBRATION. The Dowager has hit the mega-jackpot.
